name: (3-nitrophenyl)[(5E)-4-phenyl-5-(phenylhydrazono)-4,5-dihydro-1,3,4-thiadiazol-2-yl]methanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1056
Reason: 3-Nitrophenyl group: The nitro group introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. Phenyl group: The two phenyl rings can significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
